revised_title: Regulation of AP-1 Activity by Mitogen-Activated Protein Kinases
tldr: This article discusses the role of mitogen-activated protein kinases (MAPKs) in regulating AP-1 activity, a collection of dimeric transcriptional activators composed of Jun and Fos subunits. The specific roles of ERK, JNK, and FRK in modulating the level and activity of AP-1 are explored, highlighting the importance of understanding the regulation of AP-1 activity in cellular signaling and gene expression.
